title: Front Brake Caliper - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Notice - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork.
Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Note the orientation of the brake hose on the caliper for installation.
Note the orientation of the ABS sensor wire clips on the brake hose for installation.
Detach the front ABS wheel speed sensor harness from the lower clip on the front brake hose.
Disconnect the brake hose at the caliper and place the free end of the hose in a suitable container to collect the brake fluid. Discard the sealing washers.

body.name: Front brake caliper banjo and fixing_TP0180

body.body: Remove the caliper mounting fixings and slide the caliper off the disc.

body.name: Front brake caliper fixings_with hose removed_TP0182
